model_solution:
Step 1: Rewrite the expression as the product of the square roots: $\sqrt{15 \cdot 35 \cdot 21} = \sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{35} \cdot \sqrt{21}$
Step 2: Factor the radicand as much as possible: $\sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{35} \cdot \sqrt{21} = \sqrt{15 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{5 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{3 \cdot 7}$
Step 3: Group the terms that have the same radicand and compute the square root of each group: $\sqrt{15 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{5 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{3 \cdot 7} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{5 \cdot 3}$
Step 4: Group the terms that have the same radicand and compute the square root of each group: $\sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{3} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{3}$
Step 5: Combine the square roots of the terms with the same radicand: $\sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{3} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{3}$
Step 6: Multiply the terms under the square root: $\sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{3} = \sqrt{7 \cdot 3 \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot 5}$
Step 7: Factor the radicand as much as possible: $\sqrt{7 \cdot 3 \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot 5} = \sqrt{7 \cdot 3^2 \cdot 5^2}$
Step 8: Evaluate the square root of the radicand: $\sqrt{7 \cdot 3^2 \cdot 5^2} = \sqrt{7} \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{5}$
Step 9: Multiply the terms under the square root: $\sqrt{7} \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{5} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot 3 \cdot 5$
$\sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot 3 \cdot 5 = \sqrt{7 \cdot 5} \cdot 15$
steps: Step 1: Rewrite the expression as the product of the square roots: $\sqrt{15 \cdot 35 \cdot 21} = \sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{35} \cdot \sqrt{21}$
Step 2: Factor the radicand as much as possible: $\sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{35} \cdot \sqrt{21} = \sqrt{15 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{5 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{3 \cdot 7}$

Step 3: Group the terms that have the same radicand and compute the square root of each group: $\sqrt{15 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{5 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{3 \cdot 7} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{5 \cdot 3}$

Step 4: Group the terms that have the same radicand and compute the square root of each group: $\sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{3} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{3}$

Step 5: Combine the square roots of the terms with the same radicand: $\sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{3} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{3}$
Step 6: Multiply the terms under the square root: $\sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{3} = \sqrt{7 \cdot 3 \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot 5}$
Step 7: Factor the radicand as much as possible: $\sqrt{7 \cdot 3 \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot 5} = \sqrt{7 \cdot 3^2 \cdot 5^2}$
Step 8: Evaluate the square root of the radicand: $\sqrt{7 \cdot 3^2 \cdot 5^2} = \sqrt{7} \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{5}$
Step 9: Multiply the terms under the square root: $\sqrt{7} \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{5} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot 3 \cdot 5$
full_steps: Step 1: Rewrite the expression as the product of the square roots: $\sqrt{15 \cdot 35 \cdot 21} = \sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{35} \cdot \sqrt{21}$
Step 2: Factor the radicand as much as possible: $\sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{35} \cdot \sqrt{21} = \sqrt{15 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{5 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{3 \cdot 7}$

Step 3: Group the terms that have the same radicand and compute the square root of each group: $\sqrt{15 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{5 \cdot 7} \cdot \sqrt{3 \cdot 7} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{5 \cdot 3}$

Step 4: Group the terms that have the same radicand and compute the square root of each group: $\sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{15} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{3} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{3}$

Step 5: Combine the square roots of the terms with the same radicand: $\sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot \sqrt{3} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{3}$
Step 6: Multiply the terms under the square root: $\sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{3} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{3} = \sqrt{7 \cdot 3 \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot 5}$
Step 7: Factor the radicand as much as possible: $\sqrt{7 \cdot 3 \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot 5} = \sqrt{7 \cdot 3^2 \cdot 5^2}$
Step 8: Evaluate the square root of the radicand: $\sqrt{7 \cdot 3^2 \cdot 5^2} = \sqrt{7} \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{5}$
Step 9: Multiply the terms under the square root: $\sqrt{7} \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot \sqrt{5} = \sqrt{7} \cdot \sqrt{5} \cdot 3 \cdot 5$
